page.title: 16PENDEFORD & DOVECOTES ESTATE
page.content: The Dovecote Estate was built by the Local Authority, work starting in 1978, on the former Barnhurst Farm. The estate is named after the dovecote which though now derelict is still to be found on the estate. The connection with farming is also reflected in the street names. The numbering of the houses takes into account the superstition that 13 is unlucky, no number 13 houses are to be found on the estate. The Shropshire Union Canal forms a physical barrier between this public housing and the private Pendeford Estate. Built on the former Wolverhampton Municipal Airport the Pendeford Estate has been developed by six private companies to give a variety of housing types. The Local Authority has retained a small area of the land for Local Authority housing.
